laboratory_examinations.findings: Initially decreased liver function levels after alcohol cessation, but increased again after 4 weeks.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased liver function levels after controlled tea reexposure within 7 days. Another increase in liver function levels after moderate alcohol consumption. All laboratory values normalized after stopping senna and alcohol.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 330 ng/mL after 11 months of tea consumption; 130 ng/mL 2 weeks after stopping the tea; 200 ng/mL at 2 weeks after reexposure; less than 100 ng/mL 3 weeks later.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Levels decreased after stopping the tea and increased after reexposure to senna.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Results for anti-hepatitis B surface antigen and anti-hepatitis A virus antibodies were positive; tests for anti-hepatitis C virus and anti-hepatitis E virus, HIV, parvovirus B19, and Coxsackie virus were negative.
Negative for amoebas, schistosoma, and fasciola on microscopy.
Indicated recovery of endogenous adrenal function after tapering of fluticasone.
